alert.note: Alert for San Diego County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 21 at 4:06AM PST until February 25 at 3:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 3 PM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Through Wednesday, winds will gust as high as 90 mph. Snowfall through Wednesday afternoon of 2 to 4 inches below 5500 feet and 4 to 8 inches above 5500 feet. Much heavier snowfall is possible for Thursday and Friday with snow levels rising from around 3000 feet Thursday to 4500 to 5000 feet Friday afternoon and evening. * WHERE...San Diego County Mountains. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 3 PM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The low snow levels will result in snowfall impacting I-8 through much of the mountains for Wednesday through Thursday.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
